page.title: 02Finedon Parish Church
page.content: The church of St.Mary,the Virgin is about 713,years old.It is made,of local ironstone,and has a spire 133 ft.high. There are eight bells in the peal,six bells are original.It has seven stained glass windows. The church has a strainer arch built across the nave to stop the walls falling in,it is very decorative. There is a monks cell,above the porch which, now houses theological books. The organ was built by Christopher Schrieder in 1717.It came from a church in London and is supposed to have been played on by Handel.The font, pictured in one of the windows is about 914 years old. It came from a much older church and was found in a field being used as a cattle trough.
